Comment: Grob was not yet born, but his precursor decides on this unusual move.
The usual response, advancing a central Pawn and opening a line for the QB.
The Pawn does not yet need to be defended.
Bowlby goes Pawn-snatching, usually not a good idea in the opening.
Bloodgood attempts to divert Bowlby's QP.
Bowlby decides that having snatched one Pawn, discretion is the better part of valor.
Bowlby falls into it. The correct move was 5...B-Q2.
Double attack. Bowlby resigns, as the loose Bishop falls.
